metadata.titel_preek: Laodicea, Part III: The Door Of The Soul

kernfrasen: I stand at the door and knock
living too far in the back of the house
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: THE HUMAN SOUL IS A HOUSE

kernfrasen: get us on the right track
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: LIFE IS A JOURNEY TOWARD HOME
DIVINE RELATIONSHIP IS A LEGAL PROBATION

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The door of the heart... you are in control of something that not even God can countermand.

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer is the 'owner' of their internal space.
God is a polite visitor who respects boundaries.
theologische_implicaties: God's sovereignty is self-limited by human agency.
ethische_implicaties: Urgency of decision; the responsibility lies solely with the individual.
onbedoelde_consequenties: God may appear weak or helpless against a closed door.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'opening your heart' by adding spatial depth (living in the back of the house).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon centers on the 'House/Door' schema. It successfully navigates the tension between judgment and mercy by using the 'Cushion' and 'Collision' metaphors to explain textual transition.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The visceral rejection of vomiting conflicts with the gentle request for entry.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Death is framed as a temporary sleep before a homecoming, resolving the fear of the 'last knock'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses the 'back of the house' anecdote to make the abstract concept of spiritual neglect concrete.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Well, maybe they live in the back of the house.

risicos.beschrijving: The metaphor of the door is pushed so far that it suggests God is 'not in control' of salvation.
risicos.voorbeeld: God is not in control of your decision... You control that!
risicos.potentiele_impact: May lead to a theology where human will eclipses divine grace.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A house with a closed door where a visitor stands waiting.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Strongly emotional; bridges the 'Door of Memory' concept.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforces the relational safety of opening the door.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Critiques the 'cheap grace' schema of Heine.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as a Person of Integrity/Honor at Calvary.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Explicitly mentions the text as the 'call to worship' for the congregation.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by Architectural and Relational domains. It effectively uses the 'Door' as a multi-faceted portal (Conscience, Memory, Mind). The landscape is one of invitation and personal agency, though it occasionally risks diminishing divine sovereignty to emphasize human responsibility.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: The preacher admits it is 'sanitized' and avoids the visceral nature of the source.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Lean into the 'Body as Temple' schema to explain why the 'lukewarm' is physically rejected.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The body rejects what is neither nourishing nor cleansing.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The 'lie' that there are no negatives in God.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Light/Shadow' metaphor instead of 'Positive/Negative' to show that judgment is the shadow cast by the light of holiness.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If God is just a visitor, He has no ownership of the house.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Remind the hearer that the Visitor is actually the Architect and rightful Owner.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'decision' focus with 'growth' and 'patience'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using a single conceptual metaphor (The Door) to unlock multiple psychological and theological dimensions.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'goodnight/goodbye' story for its pathos, CMT reveals it as a 'DEATH IS SLEEP' vs 'DEATH IS DEPARTURE' mapping.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning cycles, CMT shows how the preacher uses the 'House' schema to categorize internal experiences like memory and conscience.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's 'lie' about God's negatives is actually a struggle with the 'GOD IS A PERSON' metaphor's entailment of mood swings.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'the lie' as a rhetorical device to manage the cognitive dissonance between God's wrath and God's love.
